design_philosophy.name: The Organic Swiss Vault
design_philosophy.description: A fusion of Swiss precision (grids, typography) with Organic warmth (stone backgrounds, deep greens). It conveys 'Trust' and 'Ephemerality'. The design is high-contrast, text-forward, and uses grain/noise to feel physical.
rules: No gradients for the sake of gradients. Use flat colors + noise.
Asymmetry creates interest. Do not center everything.
Whitespace is a luxury. Use it generously (p-8, p-12).
Motion is meaning. Use smooth transitions for all state changes.

headings.name: Outfit
headings.usage: Use for H1-H3. Tight tracking (-0.02em). Weights: 600 (Bold) or 300 (Light). Avoid 400 for headings.

body.name: Manrope
body.usage: Use for body text, UI elements, and data. Excellent for numbers (timers).
body.settings: font-feature-settings: 'tnum' on; /* Tabular numbers for timers */

scale.caption: text-sm font-medium tracking-wider uppercase text-stone-500
scale.timer: font-mono text-6xl md:text-8xl tracking-tighter font-bold text-destructive

primary.description: Deep Emerald - The color of the 'Vault'. Trust and Security.

destructive.description: Signal Red - Used for 'Self Destruct' timers and Revoke actions.

structure: Hero: Asymmetric split. Left: Large H1 + CTA. Right: Abstract 'Vault' visualization (CSS/3D).
Features: Bento Grid (Grid of cards of varying sizes).
Pricing: 3-column simple grid, high contrast for 'Pro' plan.
Footer: Massive typography 'SECURE YOUR DOCS' + Links.

dashboard.structure: Fixed Left Sidebar (w-64) + Scrollable Main Content. Top Header for Search/Profile.
dashboard.card_style: bg-white border border-stone-200 shadow-sm rounded-lg hover:shadow-md transition-shadow

viewer.structure: Centered Document Canvas. Floating Controls (Bottom or Right).
viewer.ui_elements: Glassmorphism panels (bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-md) for security status and timer.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 h-11 px-8 rounded-lg font-medium shadow-sm transition-transform active:scale-[0.98]
buttons.destructive: bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground hover:bg-destructive/90 h-11 px-8 rounded-lg shadow-sm
buttons.outline: border-2 border-primary text-primary hover:bg-primary/5 h-11 px-8 rounded-lg

inputs.default: h-12 bg-white border-stone-200 focus:border-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary rounded-lg transition-all
inputs.label: text-sm font-semibold text-stone-700 mb-2 block

cards.base: bg-white border border-stone-200 rounded-xl p-6 shadow-[0_2px_8px_rgba(0,0,0,0.04)]

status_badges.active: bg-emerald-100 text-emerald-800 px-3 py-1 rounded-full text-xs font-bold uppercase tracking-wider
status_badges.expired: bg-stone-100 text-stone-600 px-3 py-1 rounded-full text-xs font-bold uppercase tracking-wider line-through
status_badges.revoked: bg-red-100 text-red-800 px-3 py-1 rounded-full text-xs font-bold uppercase tracking-wider

visual_enhancers.texture: Add a subtle noise overlay to the body background: `background-image: url('data:image/svg+xml,...noise...')` opacity 0.03
visual_enhancers.shadows: Use 'layered' shadows for depth. Not just diffusion, but a tight ambient shadow + a larger diffuse shadow.
visual_enhancers.marquee: Use `react-fast-marquee` for a 'Security Protocols' ticker in the background of the landing page (low opacity).

instructions_to_main_agent: Install 'framer-motion' for page transitions and micro-interactions.
Create a 'Layout' component that handles the Sidebar/Navbar logic.

Use 'react-pdf' or 'react-pdf-viewer' (check license) for the PDF rendering. If not available, use iframe with restrictions or an image-based conversion backend approach (for security). For MVP, use standard object/embed with security overlays.
Implement the 'Countdown' logic on the frontend using `setInterval`, but validate strictly on backend.
Ensure the 'Viewer' page disables right-click, copy-paste, and print (via CSS and JS listeners, though not foolproof, adds friction).
For the 'Grain' effect, create a fixed `div` with `pointer-events-none` and the noise SVG as background.
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for the sake of gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
